section.names: gd0301:\ the\ generic\ type\ argument\ must\ be\ a\ variant\ compatible\ type
section.title: GD0301: The generic type argument must be a Variant compatible type

paragraph.strong: 修复是中断修复还是非中断修复

section.title: 原因
section.paragraph: An unsupported type is specified for a generic type argument when a Variant-compatible type is expected.

section.title: 规则说明
section.paragraph: When a generic type parameter is annotated with the [MustBeVariant] attribute, the generic type is required to be a Variant-compatible type. For example, the generic Godot.Collections.Array<T> type only supports items of a type that can be converted to Variant.

section.names: how\ to\ fix\ violations 如何解决冲突
section.title: 如何解决冲突
section.paragraph: To fix a violation of this rule, change the generic type argument to be a Variant-compatible type or use a different API that doesn't require the generic type argument to be a Variant-compatible type.

section.names: when\ to\ suppress\ warnings 何时禁止显示警告
section.title: 何时禁止显示警告
section.paragraph: Do not suppress a warning from this rule. API that contains generic type arguments annotated with the [MustBeVariant] attribute usually has this requirement because the values will be passed to the engine, if the type can't be marshalled it will result in runtime errors.
